intro: Canthium alleizettei, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and distinctive yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
